oai_dc:dc.dc:title: COASTAL DUNES: A STUDY OF THE DUNES AT VERA CRUZ
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Marta, Manuel Diaz
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: artificial dune construction
dune stabilization
Mexico
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Coastal dunes are formed when winds gather the dry sands from beaches and carry it inland. The repeated scouring of surface sand and its deposit in other areas does more to shape the diverse hillocks and depressions characteristic of certain coastal areas than any other physical factor. For fifty years we have been battling the sand dunes at Vera Cruz. Some observations made from the experience gained over these years may be of interest.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 6 (1957): Proceedings of 6th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Gainesville, Florida, 1957.; 28
